newsitem.title: USA: Subdued mortgage-backed mart down pre-Greenspan.
newsitem.headline: Subdued mortgage-backed mart down pre-Greenspan.

text.p: Discount mortgage coupons were off as much as 5/32 late Monday, while current coupons were down 3/32 to 4/32 in light activity ahead of Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's testimony before Congress.
Market players said the day's activity was subdued in anticipation of Greenspan's Humphrey-Hawkins address Tuesday and Wednesday.
Greenspan will offer his semi-annual remarks about the economy and monetary policy to a House Banking subcommittee on Tuesday and to the Senate Banking panel on Wednesday.
"It has been lethargic at best. We are not seeing much," said a New York trader.

Dale Westhoff, director of mortgage research at Bear Stearns & Co Inc., said there has been good two-way activity, indicating an absence of consensus among participants when it comes to the future of interest rates.
"There are a lot of two-way flows. There is a lot of disagreement," he said, adding that participants who are "even mildly bullish" on Treasuries are moving down in coupon or buying Treasuries.
